TEXT: The applicants are a couple . They are farmers residing in GPE , GPE . In the proceedings before the ORG they are represented by Mr. PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON .

On DATE ORG ) issued a decree ( Verordnung ) under LAW ( NORP ) declaring that parts of the applicants’ land fell within the danger zone ( PERSON ) of the NORP ammunition depot . It appears that certain restrictions on the use of the property at issue follow from such a declaration .
On DATE the applicants lodged a request for compensation with ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) .
On DATE ORG issued a second decree including CARDINAL further plots of land belonging to the applicants in the danger zone of the GPE ammunition depot . The decree entered into force on DATE .

On DATE the applicants , represented by counsel , specified their compensation claim as regards the plots of land affected by the DATE decree and extended their claim as regards the plots of land affected by the DATE decree .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ compensation claim as regards damages resulting from the DATE decree as well as regards damages resulting from the DATE decree . Referring to the relevant provisions of LAW , the court noted that anyone claiming damages resulting from a decree under LAW had to file a request for compensation within DATE of the entry into force of the respective decree . As to the DATE decree , the applicants had filed their compensation claim within the time - limit . However , they had implicitly waived their right to compensation as they had not pursued their claim for DATE . As to the DATE decree , the applicants had only filed their request on CARDINAL DATE . The court noted that the applicants had claimed to have made a supplementary request when lodging their first claim , in which they requested the court to take any changes of the danger zone into account and to take any necessary steps to compensate them for future damages . The court explicitly noted that it was irrelevant whether or not the applicants had filed the said supplementary request . Even if it had been made as claimed by the applicants , it did not fulfil the requirements of a compensation claim as is did not specify the plots of land concerned and the amount of compensation requested . The applicants had only made these submissions on CARDINAL DATE , i.e. outside DATE time - limit .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) upheld ORG decision as regards the refusal of compensation for damages resulting from the DATE decree . However , it quashed the said decision as regards the refusal of damages resulting from the DATE decree and referred the case back to ORG . Subsequently , the applicants were granted compensation in this respect .

On DATE ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) dismissed the ORG appeal on points of law . Referring to the relevant provisions of LAW , it noted that the claim to compensation only arises once the respective decree is issued . Thus , even assuming that the applicants had in DATE filed a supplementary request relating to possible future damages , such a request was inadmissible . As the applicants failed to specify their compensation claim within DATE of the entry into force of the DATE decree , their request was out of time and had to be rejected .
